sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A demonstration of God in his workes Against all such as eyther in word or life deny there is a God. By George More Esquire. More, George, Sir, 1553?-1632. More, George, Esquire, attributed name.
[8], 18, [2], 19-155, [5] p.
Printed by I. R[oberts] for Thomas Charde, At London : 1597.
By Sir George More (possibly the same person as George More Esquire). Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: A demonstration of God in his works. Includes index. A reissue of the edition with title page signed "George More". Identified as STC 18071+ on UMI microfilm. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[8], 18, [2], 19-155, [5] p.
Printed by I. R[oberts] for Thomas Charde, At London : 1597.
By Sir George More (possibly the same person as George More Esquire). Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: A demonstration of God in his works. Includes index. A reissue of the edition with title page signed "George More". Identified as STC 18071+ on UMI microfilm. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Thomas Charde
I. R[oberts]
